abstract: The announcement of Jay Leno’s 10 p.m. show continues to reverberate on studio lots and executive corridors in Hollywood, as the Monday-through-Friday “strip” is unprecedented in the modern network television era.
snippet: The announcement of Jay Leno’s 10 p.m. show continues to reverberate on studio lots and executive corridors in Hollywood, as the Monday-through-Friday “strip” is unprecedented in the modern network television era.
lead_paragraph: The announcement of Jay Leno’s 10 p.m. show continues to reverberate on studio lots and executive corridors in Hollywood, as the Monday-through-Friday “strip” is unprecedented in the modern network television era, Brian Stelter reports in Saturday’s New York Times:

headline.main: Leno Puts a Dent in the ‘Checkerboard’
